etymologies: early 16th century: apparently a reduced form of widersome, from obsolete wither- ‘against, contrary’ (as the part that resists the strain of the collar) + a second element of obscure origin

definitions: the highest part of a horse's back, lying at the base of the neck above the shoulders. The height of a horse is measured to the withers.
shortDefinitions: highest part of horse's back, lying at base of neck above shoulders
